channel.title: Undead Faction Idea
channel.description:
Inspired by Tormental's post.
Game Starts with a Necromancer and an Apprentice.
> # Necromancer > **Undead Special** > > Passive: Call the Darkness: You may speak with your dead allies at night, and you can hear them during the day. > > Passive: Soul Shield: If you would be killed, occupied, or redirected, the oldest other Undead will suffer those effects instead. > > Day Ability: Taint: Your target will die start bleeding. If they die from this, they will become an Undead of their type, excluding Apprentice. 4 uses. > > Night Ability: Reanimate: Turn a dead person into an Undead of the same type, excluding Apprentice. You may not use this on anyone who has already won the game, or a Death Knight. Infinite uses. You may only have up to 3 other Undead, and may not have 2 Undead Killers. > > Night Ability: Ritual: All Undead players lose the Undead passive. 1 use. This ability will be announced.
> # Apprentice > **Undead Killer** > > Passive: Eternal Servitude: When you die you will immediately become a Revenant. > > Night Ability: Dark Sacrifice: Kill a player. Unlimited uses.
> # Revenant > **Undead Killer** > > Passive: Undead: You may not be targeted at night, and cannot speak or vote with living players during the day, and you may speak to the dead. > > Night Ability: Dark Sacrifice: Kill a player. Unlimited uses. > > Night Ability: Death Ward: Kill all players that visit the Necromancer. Unlimited uses. 1 day cool down.
> # Phantom > **Undead Offensive** > > Passive: Undead: You may not be targeted at night, and cannot speak or vote with living players during the day, and you may speak to the dead. > > Passive: Undying Loyalty: Cannot be occupied or redirected. > > Night Ability: Haunt: Occupy a player. Unlimited uses. > > Night Ability: Scare: Kill a player and occupy everyone visiting them. Bypasses Immunity. 1 use.
> # Spirit > **Undead Social** > > Passive: Undead: You may not be targeted at night, and cannot speak or vote with living players during the day, and you may speak to the dead. > > Day Ability: Tamper: You can vote today. It will appear as if target player is doing it. Unlimited uses. Can't be used while using Possess. > > Night Ability: Possess: Identical to Possessor's, but you lose the Undead passive. 1 use. > > Night Ability: Ghostly Whispers: Hear all whispers to and from target player tomorrow. Unlimited uses.
> # Banshee > **Undead Support** > > Passive: Undead: You may not be targeted at night, and cannot speak or vote with living players during the day, and you may speak to the dead. > > Night Ability: Wail: Everyone will be prevented from visiting target player. 4 uses. > > Night Ability: Shriek: Kill target player. 1 use.
> # Ghoul > **Undead Investigative** > > Passive: Undead: You may not be targeted at night, and cannot speak or vote with living players during the day, and you may speak to the dead. > > Night Ability: Hidden Sight: Discover a player's class. Unlimited uses. > > Night Ability: Search: See who a player visits, and who they follow. Unlimited uses.
Note: Reanimated King is for when you reanimate the King. Not for the Evil King.
Counter Class:
> # [color=steblue]Paladin[/color] > **[color=steblue]Blue Dragon Investigative[/color]** > > Night Ability: Test Faith: Determine if a player is Cult or Undead. Unlimited uses. > > Night Ability: Smite: Prevent all visits from the Cult and Undead to your target, and kill any Cult or Undead who try 3 uses.
Promotion: Oldest Undead without the Undead passive (ironic) will become the Necromancer on his death. Generally just the Apprentice, and any Spirits, although any Undead class can with the use of Ritual.

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Exactly.

Also if any other Undead lose the Undead passive (via Possess or Ritual) they can also become the Necromancer.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
I thought Apprentice becomes Necromancer if Necromancer isn’t Necromancer anymore?

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Starting Evil King works.

If Apprentice steps up, you can have Revenant.

If Necromancer steps up, all existing Undead also remain, so kills continue.

Or you can just not step up.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: Chocolate
item.description:
How can there be an evil king without sacrificing a necessary part of the game?

What happens if Apprentice becomes King

Why did the deaths stop for three days
Kill him

Necromancer becomes King

No more necromancer whatsoever, making the entire faction basically a two-man psycho-king.Just an EK but also 1KPN

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
A reanimated King would just be a Death Knight.

There would still be an Evil King, of course.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: Chocolate
item.description:
It would be an interesting twist, making it so the BD would try not to execute a King.

Also, in an Undead game, The Evil faction just can’t afford to put any of their shills in as a King.

Because then the Necromancer would lose his Acolyte.

It’s better to raise one from the dead, even if it’s temporary.

(BD are wary of killing a king because an Unseen King can be made to exist. But in an Undead game it’s all fine and dandy, nobody would care)

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Livicus:

Just for balance purposes, I would prefer Kings not being able to be reanimated

This is why

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: Chocolate
item.description:
I thought it would be kind of cool to have one, though. Why did you do that?

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
I removed it.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: Chocolate
item.description:
I don’t see any “Reanimated King” here.

Also, you could call it the “Lich” since that is usually a King.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
RHCube:

That would be overpowered. It works for the cult because the cult can infinitely convert

Check the context. I said it wouldn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

Yes they do. The evils are very powerful and a soft counter helps to keep them in check.

They don’t. If a faction is powerful then that should be fixed by balancing them, not giving them a soft counter.
That’s bad balance. And it’s not uncommon for the BD to win after the sheriffs/paladins are dead. They’re not needed. I’d prefer it if sheriff was changed so it affects all evil factions and paladin was reworked into a support class.

NuclearBurrito:

AKA: They are useless after you have already won.

Not always. Possessor actually stands a chance. The other NKs would if they got buffed.

NightX:

kill the Mastermind.

That would be overpowered. It works for the cult because the cult can infinitely convert

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
Just for balance purposes, I would prefer Kings not being able to be reanimated.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

Yes they do. The evils are very powerful and a soft counter helps to keep them in check.

Eh. They aren’t really needed. They do work, though. Still, it would be fine to have them all be the same class.

Of course, Smite wouldn’t work for the Unseen, as it would either just stop conversions, or kill the Mastermind.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
RHCube:

Evil factions don’t need soft counters.

Yes they do. The evils are very powerful and a soft counter helps to keep them in check.

RHCube:

which makes them useless once everyone in the enemy faction is dead.

AKA: They are useless after you have already won.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
NightX:

Night Ability: Ritual: All Undead players lose the Undead passive. 1 use. This ability will be announced.

How does this work exactly? Is it like priest revive?

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Added a class for when you reanimate the King.

Note: It is not for the Evil King. It is for reanimated Kings.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
A whole faction of Death Knights.

And a couple real people.

And a Death Knight that can turn into a person.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: Livicus
item.description:
It’s like Death Knights!

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Shrimpy:

The untargetable at night passive gives away their identity to everybody …

They appear dead. And you only reanimate dead people, so this isn’t a problem.

And the only powers that allow them to talk and stuff, also make them able to be targeted.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
The untargetable at night passive gives away their identity to everybody …

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
That’s the point. It’s overpowered if it only affects evils. It should be high risk high reward.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
Then you’re casting circle of death and probably killing mostly Blue Dragon.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
That’s the main problem with the current paladin and sheriff though. And there’s still no risk to it. Omniscient abilities are never good. That’s mainly why it should affect anyone.

Read full topic

item.title: Undead Faction Idea
item.dc:creator: NightX
item.description:
If there are no Undead or Cult, why does it need to do anything? Paladin and Sheriff are like this when only the NK remains already. It also rarely happens

Read full topic
